page.title: 03WEST COKER AREA FARMING
page.content: {BRIDGE CLOSE FARM }HARDINGTON. THIS IS MAINLY A DAIRY FARM WITH SOME ARABLE AND BEEF PRODUCTION. THEY HAVE AROUND 350 COWS AT THE MOMENT,OF WHICH 150 ARE MILKING COWS,GIVING ABOUT 650 GALLONS PER DAY.THE MILKING IS ALLDONE BY MACHINE AND THE MILK IS SENT TO A LOCAL DAIRY. THE CROPS GROWN ARE FOR ANIMAL FOOD, PEAS,OATS AND GRASS FOR SILAGE. THE FARM COVERS 320 ACRES,BUT SOME OF THIS IS GRASS KEEP. THEY HAVE 3 TRACTORS,PLOUGHS,FERTILIZER SPREADERS, MOWERS AND HIRE EQUIPMENT WHEN NEEDED. THEY EMPLOY 3 PEOPLE. THE BUSYEST TIMES ARE SEPTEMBER -DECEMBER WHEN 100+ CALVES ARE BORN,ANDMAY/JUNE HARVESTING. {MILK QUOTA CUTS OF 10%}MEANS LESS FERTILIZER AND CONCENTRATES BEING USED.
